results.adx_keywords: Trading Cards;Nonfungible Tokens (NFTs);Presidential Election of 2024;United States Politics and Government;E-Commerce;Trump, Donald J
results.byline: By Michael C. Bender and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Trump Sells a New Image as the Hero of $99 Trading Cards
results.abstract: Money from sales of the digital trading cards, which depict the former president as characters like a superhero and a “Top Gun”-style fighter pilot, will go directly to him instead of his 2024 campaign.

media.caption: A photo illustration showing former President Donald J. Trump’s newly released digital trading card collection. Incentives to buy the $99 cards include entry into a series of sweepstakes to meet Mr. Trump or golf at one of his properties.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Dancing;Television;Boss, Stephen (tWitch);DeGeneres, Ellen
results.title: Stephen Boss, Dancer and Reality TV Star Known as tWitch, Dies at 40
results.abstract: Mr. Boss spent nine years with “The Ellen DeGeneres Show” as D.J., guest host and, eventually, an executive producer.

media.caption: Stephen Boss earned the nickname tWitch because he couldn’t stop moving in school or in church.
media.copyright: Maarten de Boer/NBCUniversal, via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Tests (Medical);American Rescue Plan (2021);United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Postal Service (US)
results.title: U.S. Offers Free At-Home Covid Tests as Part of Winter Plan
results.abstract: With cases on the rise, the Biden administration restarted a program that has provided hundreds of millions of tests through the Postal Service.

media.caption: Households can now order four tests at covidtests.gov, with shipments beginning next week.

results.title: How a Sprawling Hospital Chain Ignited Its Own Staffing Crisis

results.title: What are the symptoms of an infection with BQ.1 and BQ.1.1?
results.abstract: The new subvariants do not have radically different symptoms from previous versions of Omicron in vaccinated people.

results.byline: By Cara Buckley and Jason Andrew
results.title: They Fought the Lawn. And the Lawn’s Done.
results.abstract: After their homeowner association ordered them to replace their wildlife-friendly plants with turf grass, a Maryland couple sued. They ended up changing state law.

media.copyright: Jason Andrew for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Police;Decisions and Verdicts;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Dean, Aaron (Fort Worth, Tex, Police Officer);Jefferson, Atatiana (1990-2019);Fort Worth (Tex);Texas
results.title: White Officer Found Guilty in Killing of Black Woman in Her Texas Home
results.abstract: A former Fort Worth police officer, Aaron Dean, was convicted of manslaughter in the shooting of Atatiana Jefferson. She was shot through her bedroom window.
per_facet: Dean, Aaron (Fort Worth, Tex, Police Officer)

media.caption: Dale Smith, assistant Tarrant County criminal district attorney, left, cross-examined Aaron Dean on Monday.

results.byline: By Mike Isaac and Kate Conger
results.title: Twitter Suspends Accounts of Half a Dozen Journalists
results.abstract: The social media service, which is owned by Elon Musk, said that it suspends accounts that “violate the Twitter rules” but did not provide details.

media.caption: The Twitter profiles of three journalists whose accounts were suspended on Thursday.
media.copyright: Photo illustration by The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Emergency Medical Treatment;Doctors;Hospitals;Research;Deaths (Fatalities);Medicine and Health;Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality;American College of Emergency Physicians;Johns Hopkins University
results.title: E.R. Doctors Misdiagnose Patients With Unusual Symptoms
results.abstract: Doctors fail to recognize serious conditions like stroke and sepsis in tens of thousands of patients each year, according to a new study.
org_facet: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality

media.caption: While these errors remain relatively rare in the emergency room, they are most likely to occur when someone presents with symptoms that are not classic signs of a condition.
media.copyright: Adria Malcolm for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Defense and Military Forces;Drones (Pilotless Planes);vis-photo;Bakhmut (Ukraine);Russia;Ukraine
results.byline: By Thomas Gibbons-Neff and Tyler Hicks
results.title: The Infrared Hunt for Russian Troops in the Battle for Bakhmut
results.abstract: On a frigid December night, The New York Times accompanied members of a surveillance team for the Ukrainian Army as they used a thermal sight to find enemy positions miles away.

media.caption: A surveillance team of the Ukrainian Army trying to locate Russian positions for artillery strikes this month.

results.adx_keywords: Stocks and Bonds;Musk, Elon;Tesla Motors Inc;Twitter
results.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Peter Eavis
results.title: Elon Musk Sells Another Big Chunk of Tesla Stock
results.abstract: Twitter’s owner has now sold $23 billion worth of Tesla stock this year, much of it after he pledged in April to stop selling shares to finance his deal to acquire the social media company.

media.caption: Elon Musk has disclosed that he had sold another $3.6 billion worth of Tesla stock.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Propaganda;Censorship;Politics and Government;Computers and the Internet;Television;News and News Media;E-Mail;Putin, Vladimir V;Carlson, Tucker;Fox News Channel;RT (TV Network);Russia;China
results.byline: By Paul Mozur, Adam Satariano and Aaron Krolik
results.title: An Alternate Reality: How Russia’s State TV Spins the Ukraine War
results.abstract: Leaked emails detail how Russia’s biggest state broadcaster, working with the nation’s security services, mined right-wing American news and Chinese media to craft a narrative that Moscow was winning.

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Tuition;Prices (Fares, Fees and Rates);Scholarships and Fellowships;Financial Aid (Education);Colby-Sawyer College
results.title: A Sign That Tuition Is Too High: Some Colleges Are Slashing It in Half
results.abstract: Colby-Sawyer in New Hampshire has reduced its tuition to $17,500 a year, from about $46,000. But the cut is also a recognition that few pay the list price.

media.caption: Colby-Sawyer has joined a growing number of small, private colleges in what’s called the tuition reset.
media.copyright: Kelly Burgess for The New York Times
